definition: to bear/to endure/to tolerate/to restrain oneself
to suffer/to endure/to pull through (hard times)/to delay/to stall/to play for time/to dawdle

sentences.english: And they preferred hunger and famine to the desecration of the ancestral grave…
sentences.chinese: 他们宁可自己忍饥挨饿也不愿亵渎祖先们的坟茔。

sentences.english: An acute lack of nutriment brought hunger to the Iraqi human.
sentences.chinese: 食品重大缺乏，伊拉克人民正在忍饥挨饿。

sentences.english: There are still hungry people in the world .
sentences.chinese: 世界上还有忍饥挨饿的人。

sentences.english: The population of that country suffers from hunger.
sentences.chinese: 那个国家的人民忍饥挨饿。

sentences.english: People may not be hungry, but this is farming at its most basic.
sentences.chinese: 人们并不会忍饥挨饿，但务农是这里的生活之道。

sentences.english: The local fishermen have suddenly lost their livelihoods, and they are starving.
sentences.chinese: 当地渔民突然抓不到鱼了，他们都在忍饥挨饿。

sentences.english: An acute lack of nutriment bring hunger to the Iraqi people.
sentences.chinese: 食品重大缺乏，伊拉克人民正在忍饥挨饿。

sentences.english: His heart ached for the starving homeless.
sentences.chinese: 他对这忍饥挨饿的无家可归者表示怜悯。
比如存在着忍饥挨饿的孩子或者垂死挣扎的母亲。

definition: lit. food not filling the stomach (idiom)/fig. poverty-stricken
beset by hunger and cold (idiom)/starving and freezing/in desperate poverty
to save on food and clothing (idiom); to live frugally
to be without food or clothing (idiom)/to be very poor
to starve to death/to be very hungry
to tighten one's belt/to live more frugally
lit. clothes not covering the body (idiom)/fig. poverty-stricken
to economize on clothes and food/to scrimp and save (idiom)
